Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [exiting office] Everyone stop what you're doing, I have terrible news. Dwight is no longer with us.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [gasps] What?! Why is that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He's gone, damn it! He's been promoted to VP of Sabre Retail and he's staying in Florida forever.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So, he's alive.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. That was him on the phone. He sounds wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, the way you said it made it sound like he was dead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How could I have been more clear? He had a massive stroke [slight pause] of good fortune and he is now in a better place.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: If Dwight's not coming back, does that mean we can open his treasure?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You guys, we've gone over this, there is no treasure. [Erin retrieves the "treasure box" and slams it down on Dwight's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: When the team left for Tallahassee, Dwight told everyone not to touch his treasure. [cut to Dwight holding treasure chest and telling the office "Don't touch my treasure. Ok, you understand?"] Obviously he wants us to obsess about it. There's nothing in there. [has realization] Which is obviously what he would want us to think, making it the perfect place to hide a treasure. Oh god, I'm Wallace Shawn in The Princess Bride.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think that Dwight wanted us to realize that this conversation among friends is the true treasure. [everyone disagrees]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I am dying to know what's in there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know, Oscar we all are but nobody's gonna open it. You'd have to be insane. [everyone turns to look at Creed]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hi, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Creed standing in front of the "treasure box"] Now, carefully... open the box.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [opens box, pulls out and displays contents] It's a photo of all of us.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw, that's so sweet! [dart fires out of box and lodges in ceiling]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [feigning surprise] A dart? Are you kidding me? Who would put a poison dart, well, I mean, I don't know that it's poison. I mean, I just have to imagine. God, I'm glad he's OK though. Kinda sounds like he deserved it, opening another man's treasure and all. Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on a golf course] Well, mister ball, it's been a pleasure. Now, give my regards to hell. Da! [hits ball]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, all right! Well swung my VIP VP.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I am loving the chemistry between you two.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I am so happy Dwight is gonna be working alongside me. We are a regular Archibald and his man George.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I bet. I'm excited.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Trick... there's no such thing. It's not even a real English duo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I just made you look like the goat of Dover. And that doesn't exist either.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Robert] You think you're excited? You should feel my nipples. [Robert gives a fake laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that reminds me. [reaching into golf cart] Little something from all of us. [hand Dwight a small wrapped gift]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Oh my gosh, thank you Jim, that's so thoughtful. [sets gift on golf tee] Four! [smashes gift] Oh yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: He doesn't even care.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't even care!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is the last time I'll ever see Dwight. It's a weird feeling, it's, um, what's the word? It's not, it's not bittersweet. It's uh... sweet. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [entering Andy's office] Hey, man. Selling cookies for Jada. Want the same as last year?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Would if I could. And I can so I will. Put me down for one box. Don't care what it is, dealer's choice.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll put you down for shortbreads.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [entering Andy's office] Knock, knock. Hey, Sasha's first year in the troops, so I'm selling cookies for her. Anyway, would you like some?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I been selling here for five years. This is my spot.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You can't claim territories. This is the only place I interact with people. Can't you sell at your church or barber shop? [Darryl looks hurt] Or chess club, or?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You know what? It's your first time, let's split the office. You can have sales, the annex, Creed, and I don't know I'll just take, uh, accounting.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's it? Yeah, well, ok. Thanks Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK, great.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [exits Andy's office smiling] All I need is Kevin. Dude buys more cookies than everyone combined and then some. [Kevin waves at him] When I first started selling cookies he was a relatively thin man. Not a thin man, mind you. Relatively thin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [entering a home carrying groceries] Hellosi, I'm home, babaloo.

Quote.Speaker: Elderly Woman
Quote.Text: [rises from chair] Oh, here let me help.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [spilling groceries] I got it. It was so busy at the store today. Really good cheese samples. I had, like, a hundred.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Irene hired me as her live-in helper. We met at the store launch. I told her I was moving here and I needed a place and it just sort of made sense. I basically do everything for her. [Erin randomly adds an assortment of pills to a weekly pill box] I run errands. I do chores around the house. I cook and clean. Honestly, I don't know how she survived without me.

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: When can I introduce you to my grandson? He's a wonderful swimmer. Shallow end, deep end. He does it all.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, today might be kind of tough, Irene. I have to talk to my old boss, Andy, and tell him I'm staying in Florida. [hands Irene a mug]

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: [takes mug] Thank you. [takes a sip] Oh, what kind of tea is this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I boiled some Gatorade.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [misses putt] Ah. In England, they put the holes a little bit to the right, you see. We'll just chalk it up to cultural bias.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: If I may, [assists Nellie] try holding the putter... yeah, with your wrists here. And your thumbs here.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: That's right. Your little finger.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [approaches Kevin] Would you like to buy some cookies?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cookies, eh?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] Oh, the springtime thinks that it's the best. And fall time thinks that it's the best. Cold time has, kind of a strut. And Valentine's thinks that it's the best. But gather round, peeps, I'll tell you the truth. Nothing beats the cookie season, that's the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Kevin scratches cookie order form and sniffs it] It's not a scratch-and-sniff, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I know. But sometimes you still get a little something.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [to Darryl] Hey, you tricked me. You just wanted Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're new to the game. You learned a lesson today. See you next year, sport.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no, no. It's not fair. What if Kevin wants to buy cookies from me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: See?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That doesn't mean anything. [to Kevin] Kevin, do you want to buy cookies from me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I definitely do.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [to Toby] Huh. Hit the road, jack.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, you hit the road, jack.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [looking pleased] Hey guys, come on. Don't fight over me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know, why don't we split the order? It's only fair.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. Wait, no. I'm buying, I make the rules. I actually do want you to fight over me. I wanna be wined and dined and... 69ed.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Metaphorically 69ed. Ew. Perverts... no offence Oscar. [Oscar looks flabbergasted]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hop in, we have places to be. No rest for the wicked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] All right. So... I guess this is it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, Jim, I just want to say that we haven't always got along and at times, I've even hated your guts. But...[smiles] bye, bye. I win.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [attempts to shake Dwight's hand] Goodbye, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [drops golf ball into Jim's open hand] Robert, race you to the clubhouse, gentlemen's bet. Woohoo! [takes off in golf cart]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, he's Florida's problem now.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I'll let Dwight have his fun. Today will not be his day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I'm gonna tank the Sabre store at the presentation to the board.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought you liked the store?

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: Well, the store is lovely. You created a wonderful space to showcase our product line. Great job. Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: But, there's a reason we sell our products online and over-the-phone. Have you ever used Sabre electronics, Jim? [Jim shakes head] They're cheap. They're unintuitive. The Sabre store would work if we adopted the carnival model of leaving town once everyone's wives do us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. When you put it that way, I guess it does sound pretty terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I couldn't just kill the project from the start. Jo Bennett endorsed it. Shame though, I did like Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [from distanced golf cart] Robert! I'm gonna win, ha ha, I'm the gentleman! Suck it!

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Bravo, Dwight! Very good! [Jim looks surprised] [to Jim] Shame.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [at Sabre headquarters] The math is simple folks. Deeper market penetration, plus greater visibility, will raise Sabre [Nellie emerges from behind Dwight] [together] to the power of two.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: How did that look?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm not just saying this, that was the best thing I've ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Nellie] I told you.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: When you guys do that whole power of two shebang, how 'bout I pop up also? I guess we'd have to say 'power of three'. Hm, actually, you know what, yeah, that actually works. [to Nellie] You'd spin off right. I'd spin off-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? That is a great idea. Cathy, write that down and print it out. It's gonna make some really good toilet paper.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [enters room] All right. There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing here? I thought I got rid of you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I just talk to you for one quick second?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What, your stylist ran out of 'messy spray'? [others laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, actually it's, it's for your own good. I think maybe we should- [gestures toward hallway]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want to do something for my own good? Turn around, walk out that door, do not stop 'til you get to Scranton, find my cell phone charger, mail it back to me, and then go hell. [others laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Nice. [To Jim] Hey, Halpert, anyone ever tell you you look like Wooly Willy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Packer] Silence.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Aw, I'm just trying to-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [interrupts] I know what you're trying to do, I don't want it. [to Jim] But your face does look like the guy from Operation.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: That's... that's the same guy. It's the joke I made.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Different guy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, I just think you should know that-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [interrupts] That you look like the world's tallest hobbit. [others laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I tried. [gestures the meeting room] You saw it, so, it's on the record. I have a plane to catch.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Can you help me? I'm trying to make a video chat with Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: Just open the program and type in his user name.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Can you just do it?

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: [after briefly typing] Here, type in your password.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: 'Erin123'

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: That's a terrible password. And you don't 'make a video chat', you video chat.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [annoyed] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's so weird. There's something wrong with my laptop. [turns laptop on its side] Oh. I fixed it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, now mine's broken. Hang on. [turns his laptop on its side while lying on desk] Oh, there we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone with Jim] He said, 'I did like Dwight'? He's gonna fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, I think it was more like, 'you know, I liked him, but I don't anymore because he did a bad job, so I'm definitely gonna yell at him'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Robert doesn't talk like that. You have to stop Dwight from doing this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I tried. He will not listen.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you actually try your hardest?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes... my pretty hardest. Look, you haven't dealt with him in awhile, all right. He's like super Dwight. It's like he's been bitten by a radioactive Dwight, or som- Stanley, back me up.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Don't talk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley's very upset that we're leaving Florida. But he would back me up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If Dwight's about to get fired, you have to tell him. Just get the words out. That's all you can do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] What's a skinny guy like Toby know about cookies? You can't trust him to understand the wants and needs of the thick man. Maybe Toby from two years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [laughs] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's true. If I have a question about my cookies at midnight, who am I gonna call? Darryl. Toby's probably in bed with some model.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm, I'm not gonna comment on my personal life.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look, I need this. Ok? Your daughter is a pretty little girl. Let her go door-to-door. You think people gonna buy cookies from my [hesitates] chubby daughter?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh. [looks away]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Baby, if you're watching this, you're not chubby, you're beautiful. Daddy's just got to sell some cookies. And we're also gonna exercise more. It's gonna be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Oh, you know what you have to do? To decide? You need to make them do things for you. And, like, buy you things.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or have them sing that song! That the frog does in Looney Tunes.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Make them kiss each other.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Make them kiss me. [everyone 'ew's] [Toby and Darryl look at each other]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes, this is too tan. This right here-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This is a tanned spot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't buy it. It, that is a freckle. That is not a tan, ok? I'm gonna have to inspect it in person when you get back here. I want you looking totally 'puerto ricania' when i see you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, Andy, I'm not coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I have a job here. I work for an old lady. [turns laptop to put Irene into view]

Quote.Speaker: Irene
Quote.Text: [waves] Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's awesome. That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Toby and Darryl perform Hello! Ma Baby] This is tough. 'Cause Darryl, you sang better and you dance better but Toby has that indescribable quality that makes a star. I think I've reached my decision. I have decided... that you guys are gonna keep doing things for me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. It's not worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, it's not worth it? That's too bad. 'Cause I was feeling particularly hungry this year.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, ok so what, you buy 40 boxes?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hungrier.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hungrier.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're not talking... triple digits?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, I'm talking triple digits. [folds arms satisfied while Toby and Darryl look at each other] Again. [both start performing Hello! Ma Baby again]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [straightens tie in mirror] Showtime.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [enters abruptly] Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You again? Gosh, I keep throwing you away, you keep flying back here. You're like an Amish return stick.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, great, listen to me. Listen to me. [Dwight makes funny gesture] No, no, I know. Will you just let me tell you one thing, please?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, you may tell me one thing. Wait, you want to borrow money?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen to me. Robert is going to veto the Sabre store.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [rolls eyes] Jim, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, he's gonna kill the store.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then, I'm pretty sure he's gonna fire you for it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait. [holds up fingers] He's gonna kill the store? And he's gonna fire me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [smiles] That's two things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice try, Jim. Your pranks have never worked in the past and they're not going to work today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, first of all, they've mostly worked, so-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? You might want to get to the airport. It's gonna take you a long time to get through security with all those beauty products. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, come o-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing is gonna stop me. That is the mark of a great man. Unstoppability. Dunder-Mifflin, the farm, Mose, all those things vanish in my rearview mirror. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a date with destiny. And from what I hear, she's a slu- Ah![Jim tackles Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jim holds him back and tries to cover his mouth] Help! Help!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gross! Don't lick my hand! God, why is there so much saliva?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: AlI had to do was think about pie and my salivary glands did the rest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gross!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [attempting to break from Jim's grasp] Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? What, what, what, what, what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clutching side] Oh, god! You... oh! My appendix-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My wound hasn't healed yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, I forgot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You all right? You ok?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [stops whining and charges Jim] Rrrah!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [to Cathy] Where the hell is he? I cannot do this without him.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: I don't know. He's not picking up.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Well, looks like Shnoot's a no-show. Guess he wasn't vice presy material after all. But I am. Put me in, babe. I got the info down backwards, forwards, and doggy-style. I'm your man.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [considers and decides on Packer] Right, let's begin then. Ladies and gentlemen, allow me to introduce the vice president of Sabre Retail, Mr. Todd Packer.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Sup?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [notices Andy boxing up things from Erin's desk] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm just dealing with Erin's stuff since apparently she's not coming back. And she didn't bother to tell anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We knew. Ryan told us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ryan, why didn't you tell me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thought you checker my Tumblr?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You never update it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, I updated it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does anyone else think this is weird? And like, kind of uncool, actually? To leave us without a receptionist?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We'll find another receptionist. I mean, that's easy. We'll be fine. [Andy nods reluctantly]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [trying to get around Jim] Huh, huh, huh! [slides between Jim's legs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was trying to go-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Get up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Get up. All right? I'm not gonna let you by.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then you know what? I'm just gonna have to run right through you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. [Dwight runs in place] What are you doing? Are you really revving up? you know that doesn't work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tries to jump off wall] Jackie Chan! [falls and groans]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [holding mobile phone up] Go.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [in a feminine voice] Hi. This is Alex.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [in feminine voice] And this is Sam.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [in a feminine voice] Kevin can't come to the phone right now because he's busy with us.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Perfect! Now people will think I'm doing hot girls all day.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't know, man, they might think we're drag queens.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't know why you picked names that are also guys' names.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, now who do I ride to the kitchen like a pony?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Don't make me be your pony, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Forget it, man.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm out. And so is Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This may be wrong. But there's a limit to what I would do for my child.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. I have my dignity too. I refuse to be another man's horsey.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No guys, stop! You have to sell me cookies. I'll do anything. [starts performing Hello! Ma Baby] I'm even gonna kiss Meredith. [kisses Meredith] That is... hmph... that's ah... so good. [almost in tears Meredith pulls him toward her by his tie]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [tackled by Dwight] What are you doing? No. No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This. Ends. Now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [picks Jim up] Rrahh! [both fall]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Anything else you need to talk about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. I think that was it. [Dwight gets up and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking disheveled in mirror] Once again, it's show time.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: What baffles me is how you could take a perfectly good idea, [Dwight enters] which the great Jo Bennett rightfully signed off on, and then utterly botch it in execution.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: If I may speak to that, I have only been vice president of this project for the last half hour, so the man you want is Dwight Shrute.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: I don't see Dwight. He clearly had the infinite wisdom to stay as far away from this clown show as possible.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Whatever you do, do not blame Todd Packer. It is not his fault. Blame his upbringing, his parents, the society that would mold this idiotic creature. Fire the employee, yes... but not the man. You may not cancel his soul.

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: That was never on the table.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [to Nellie] Are you kidding? [to Robert] She's the queen of the whole freaking Magilla!

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: And yet Todd, it's you who's fired.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: What, you, I, I can't get fired. I'm an institution. I have been at this company for 20 years. How many of you have been here that long, huh? [Dwight exits meeting room and helps Jim up]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Dwight and Jim enter office] Hey, hey. They're back. [Everyone greets them]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dwight, what are you doing here? I thought you were supposed to be in Florida?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, the crazy thing about that is, um, wow you look great. Did you lose some weight?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thank you, for someone who actually notices this. No, I didn't lose weight. But I started using my makeup to contour my face to look skinnier. I actually put on five pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to Stanley] Hey! Good to have you back.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [insincerely] Good to be back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Hey, stranger!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw, I missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I missed you. [they embrace and kiss as Andy watches on sadly]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm going to Florida to get Erin. [grabs coat, runs out, then returns] Forgot to turn off my email. It's crazy, right? It's just, when she said she was leaving, I felt so- [looks at computer frustrated] 'You're about to close four tabs, are you sure you want to continue?' Yes. I am sure. Ah, slow computer!
